p: Sesaminol and pinoresinol occur in sesame seeds mainly in glycosylated forms ( Table 3 and Figure 4). Sesame oil contains aglycons and some monoglycosylated lignans, while most of di- and tri-glycosylated lignans remain in oil-free meal after oil extraction. Major glycosylated lignans in sesame seeds are di- and triglucosides of pinoresinol [ 76, 98], mono-, di- and triglucosides of sesaminol [ 99], and sesamolinol diglucoside [ 100]. The structures of glucosylated lignans of sesame are shown in Figure 4. Enzymatic deglucosylation of lignan glucosides is reviewed in Section 2.2.2.
